<u>7216<\u> <s>[text?]<\s> Tuesday early[?]
<s>National Antarctic Expedition 
Reports from the [text?]<\s>
Discovery 
Off Cape Adare 
Jany 9th 1902
To be forwarded to 
The Secretary 
National Antarctic Expedition 
University Building 
Burlington Gardens 
London W
For the information of the Presidents of the Royal & 
Royal Geographical Societies of England 
Sirs 
<s>Pr<\s> Proceeding south on the 178th meridian we fell in 
with icebergs on the afternoon of Jan 2nd in Lat 65.30S 
We crossed the antarctic circle before noon on the 
following day and that night passed through several 
streams of field ice 
These gradually became closer & by noon on the 4th we 
were in thick pack ice in Lat 67.45S 
From the 4th to the 7th the pack remained close 
but by noon on the latter day we were in latitude 
68.52S Long 175.38E having forced our way 
Southward & westward 
Up to the afternoon of the 6th we were able to proceed 
with one boiler alight & with some assistance from 
the sails but after that it became necessary 
to develop greater power and steam was got up in
